WPFToggleBingSearch.Description: If enable then includes web search results from Bing in your Start Menu search.

WPFToggleNumLock.Description: Toggle the Num Lock key state when your computer starts.

WPFToggleVerboseLogon.Description: Show detailed messages during the login process for troubleshooting and diagnostics.

WPFToggleSnapWindow.Description: If enabled you can align windows by dragging them. | Relogin Required

WPFToggleSnapFlyout.Description: If enabled then Snap preview is disabled when maximize button is hovered.

WPFToggleSnapSuggestion.Description: If enabled then you will get suggestions to snap other applications in the left over spaces.

WPFToggleMouseAcceleration.Description: If Enabled then Cursor movement is affected by the speed of your physical mouse movements.

WPFToggleStickyKeys.Description: If Enabled then Sticky Keys is activated - Sticky keys is an accessibility feature of some graphical user interfaces which assists users who have physical disabilities or help users reduce repetitive strain injury.

WPFToggleHiddenFiles.Description: If Enabled then Hidden Files will be shown.

WPFToggleShowExt.Description: If enabled then File extensions (e.g., .txt, .jpg) are visible.

WPFToggleTaskbarSearch.Description: If Enabled Search Button will be on the taskbar.

WPFToggleTaskView.Description: If Enabled then Task View Button in Taskbar will be shown.

WPFToggleTaskbarWidgets.Description: If Enabled then Widgets Button in Taskbar will be shown.

WPFToggleTaskbarAlignment.Description: [Windows 11] If Enabled then the Taskbar Items will be shown on the Center, otherwise the Taskbar Items will be shown on the Left.

WPFToggleDetailedBSoD.Description: If Enabled then you will see a detailed Blue Screen of Death (BSOD) with more information.
